newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian gold, silver close higher on thin supply.
newsitem.headline: Indian gold, silver close higher on thin supply.

text.p: Gold and silver opened on a subdued note but lifted smartly towards close, aided by thin supplies and a shortage of ready stock, dealers said.

"Fresh physical buying ahead of festivals as well as renewed speculative buying also pushed the market upwards," said a dealer. On Tuesday gold was up 12 rupees per 10 grammes and silver 75 rupees per kg.
Gold biscuits (116.50 grammes) settled 100 rupees higher at 60,700 rupees.
Dealers said the market undertone was firm due to an uptrend in the world market.
